pr_title: Allow changes to storage overrides before scale-up or after scale-down

timeline.message:
Allow changes to storage overrides before scale-up or after scale-down

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

timeline.bodyText: any reason for not calling using nodeId directly in the for loop?
timeline.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: It is used in the lambdas when filtering the lists. So it needs to be effectively final. That is why I do not use i directly.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: Maybe not related to this PR but why the zkCurrentReplicas is declared as Integer and not just a simple int which makes a little bit different the way we pass the old replicas between ZooKeeper and Kafka in the next code? Can the getReplicas() return null on a StatefulSet? The same is used in the KafkaClusterDescription but setting an int so I would say no.
timeline.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText:
zkCurrentReplicas is used by the Zookeeper scaling where null indicates bascially new cluster. Therefore it exists as Integer and is a class variable. Thsi is there for a long time, I really just reuse the variable instead of creating another local one just for the Storage diff.
For Kafka we do not use it anywhere for anything else. So I created a new local variable and since the storage diff has a different requirements it is sufficient this time to use int.
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: Ah ok, now I see zkCurrentReplicas stays null when there is no STS yet, so new cluster. Thanks.
replies.author: ppatierno
